item.title: Susan add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I suppose it was a romantic was to perish... for a mouse" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Susan add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Miss Barry was a kindred spirit after all," Anne confided to Marilla, "You wouldn't think so to look at her, but she is. . . Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Susan add a quote by Edgar Allen Poe
item.description: "We loved with a love that was more than love." -- Edgar Allen Poe

item.title: Susan add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Susan add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Susan add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Susan add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Susan add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "<i>Ginny!</i>" said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. "Haven't I taught you <i>anything</i>? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself <i>if you can't see where it keeps its brain</i>?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Susan add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them. In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Susan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Susan add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Maybe they know what I know, that the true way to a man's heart is six inches of metal between his ribs. Sometimes four inches will do the job, but to be really sure, I like to have six." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Susan add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "What you have lost will not be returned to you; it always be lost. You’re left with only your scars to mark the void. All you can choose to do is go on, or not. But if you go on, it’s knowing you carry your scars with you." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Susan add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "[Children] just cannot be sad too long, it is not in them, as children mourn in little bits here and there like patchwork in their lives." -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Susan add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "You can smile when your heart is breaking because you're a woman." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Susan add a quote by Rebecca Wells
item.description: "What does my smile look like now? Vivi wondered. Can you reclaim that free-girl smile, or is it like virginity- once you loose it, that's it?" -- Rebecca Wells

item.title: Susan add a quote by Rebecca Wells
item.description: "Sidda can't help herself. She just loves books. Loves the way they feel, the way they smell, loves the black letters marching across the white pages..." -- Rebecca Wells

item.title: Susan add a quote by Rebecca Wells
item.description: "Listen to me, Siddalee, and listen good: There is no excuse to let your looks go, no matter how poor you are. Cleanliness is next to Godliness, but honey let me tell you, ugliness will get you nowhere." -- Rebecca Wells

item.title: Susan add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Susan add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "I will remember what I was, I am sick of rope and chains - I will remember my old strength and all my forest affairs. I will not sell my back to man for a bundle of sugar cane; I will go out to my own kind, and the wood-folk in their lairs. I will go out until the day, until the morning break - Out to the wind's untainted kiss, the water's clean caress; I will forget my ankle-ring and snap my picket stake. I will revisit my lost love and playmates masterless!" -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Susan add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Susan add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Susan add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Susan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Susan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Susan add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Susan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Susan add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Susan add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott
